result.execSummary:
The defendant Andre R Torres was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Mother to the Court.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Andre R Torres in court with attorney Angel Johnson.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.

Defendant sentenced to serve FIVE (5) DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for FIVE (5) DAYS time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION..

OTHER CONDITIONS:

* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges BY 05-31-2018 or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH tax intercept.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief;
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Andre R Torres in court with attorney Angel Johnson.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Defense advised that she will NOT be having the matter Staffed.  Defense and Defendant conceded that there is a FACTUAL basis for the REVOCATION.  The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of judgment of conviction.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 31, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Andre R Torres in court with attorney Angel Johnson.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

State RENEWED their motion to REVOKE.  Defense requested matter be set for Staffing.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for May 8, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Andre R Torres in court with attorney Angel Johnson.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  State moved to REVOKE the DPA.  Defense advised that she does NOT have the file.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Revocation/Sentencing.  Review hearing scheduled for April 17, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Oral No Contact Order with Walmart, 10600 W Layton Ave.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Andre R Torres in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 13, 2017 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Andre R Torres
Current: 3729 W National Ave Upper, Milwaukee, WI 53220   (Effective: 03-04-2017)
Prior: 6600 West Forest Home Ave, #106, Milwaukee, WI 53220
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Andre R Torres not in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Matter in Court for Review.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Dated 10-23-2015.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Andre R Torres in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has completed 5 of 10 hours of community service.  With agreement of parties, Court extends Deferred Prosecution Agreement to next court date.  Case adjourned for final review hearing in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Deferred Prosecution Agreement report, received and filed. cmt

Defendant Andre R Torres in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant has community service hours to complete.   Based upon the defendant's compliance with Deferred Prosecution Agreement, matter is adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Andre R Torres in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defendant has tested positive, which has been addressed by the monitoring agency.  Defendant is attending treatment and will begin community service.

  All parties notified, effective August 1, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Joseph Donald, Branch 2.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Review hearing scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Deferred Prosecution Agreement Progress report, received and filed. lms

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.

Defendant Andre R Torres in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defense waived reading and momentarily enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of client.  Review hearing scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Court appearance scheduled in Room 310, Safety Building, on  2-23-2015 at 8:30am
